thread.title: Arsenal press conference - 5 things you may have missed ahead of Hull Clash
thread.title_full: Arsenal press conference - 5 things you may have missed ahead of Hull Clash

author: Arash Hekmat
title: Arsenal press conference - 5 things you may have missed ahead of Hull Clash
text:
Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsene Wenger faced the media in an unusually cagey mood ahead of Saturday's Premier League clash between Arsenal and Hull. 
Amid growing fan discord and another faltering title bid, the Arsenal manager was keen to express the need for unity among his players and supporters. 
The beleaguered Gunners boss also gave the latest weekly update on his own future, as well as discussing those of Jack Wilshere and Joe Hart. 
Oh, and there was also some team news too, with updates on Hector Bellerin and Mohamed Elneny ahead of Saturday's game. 
Read on for five things you may have missed in the presser: Read More Arsene Wenger calls for unity as he urges Arsenal to stick together amid fan unrest 1) Wenger calls for unity, praises Spurs supporters Wenger took a dig at Arsenal fans with his complementary words for Spurs supporters (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur FC/Getty Images) 
Wenger ensured a bit of spiciness remains with the fans after taking a swipe at them in the wake of Bannergate by suggesting they might be more like their counterparts up Seven Sisters Road. 
The Frenchman, whose side are now behind their local rivals in the Premier League, said: "Our fans have been consistent and have a high level of expectation as I do, but I don't feel you can be a fan until last Tuesday and then not be behind the team anymore - it doesn't make sense. Read More Arsenal legend Kenny Sansom calls on Arsene Wenger to quit 
"All the other clubs, Manchester United, Manchester City, Liverpool, they have big expectations and big history.We are in a fight and we have to be united or we have no chance. 
"You have Tottenham as well and everyone is behind their team and we have to do the same." There's growing unrest at the Emirates Stadium (Photo: Getty Images) 2) Arsenal CAN catch Chelsea and win the league The Frenchman denies Arsenal were comfortably second-best against Chelsea (Photo: David Price) 
The Frenchman is adamant that the title race isn't over yet , even if Chelsea are 12 points ahead of his club and showing no signs of slowing down. 
Famous for insisting that it's never over until it's no longer mathematically possible, Wenger admitted that things might be "more difficult than ever" this season. 
“If it is over for us, it is over for everybody else. We are together in the pack there. 
“If you can reduce the distance to Chelsea, you never know. 
“They are in a strong position.” Read More 3) Arsenal have no need for Joe Hart Joe Hart had been linked with a shock move to Arsenal (Photo: Getty) 
Less than 24 hours after being linked with Torino keeper Joe Hart, the Gunners boss emphatically denied that he has any interest in the Manchester City loanee . 
First-choice stopper Petr Cech has come in for some flack after his performance against Chelsea, but Wenger was keen to back his Czech shot-stopper. 
“I have three world-class goalkeepers and I am happy with what I have," he told reporters. 
And on Cech specifically, the Frenchman added: "He is serious and prepares well. He was at fault on the third goal but overall I feel he has had a good season." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
